titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow employers a tax credit for hiring displaced homemakers.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 1/6/1999--Introduced. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to qualify employment of displaced homemakers for the targeted jobs income tax credit. Defines "displaced homemaker" as an individual who: (1) has not worked in the labor force for at least five years but has, during those years, worked in the home providing unpaid services for family members; and (2) has been dependent on public assistance or on the income of another family member but is no longer supported by that income or is receiving public assistance on account of dependent children in the home.
